clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Covid 19 Pandemic on the Training of General Surgery Residents
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Covid 19 Pandemic on the Training of General Surgery Residents

lead_sponsor.agency: Iuliu Hatieganu University of Medicine and Pharmacy

clinical_study.source: Iuliu Hatieganu University of Medicine and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock:
The educational process of general surgery residents is a very important step in every surgeon's career, which is often overlooked or neglected. The Covid-19 pandemic has inflicted deep changes in the medical activity in general and in the training process of young doctors in particular.
Our study aims to assess the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on the educational process of general surgery residents, through a comparative study. The responses of resident doctors at a questionnaire, in two different time periods, will be compared: pre-Covid era (December 2019) and Covid era (December 2020).

primary_outcome.measure: The impact of the pandemic on the educational process
primary_outcome.description: Active participation in the operating room (hours/day, day/week), Theoretical education (hours/week), possibilities of extracurricular training

intervention.description: The study evaluates the training process of general surgery residents - in classic surgery, as well as laparoscopic surgery, from hospital activity to extracurricular activities.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- General surgery residents
- Above second year of residency
- Residency program in Cluj-Napoca Medical Centre
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incomplete responses to the questionnaire
- Refusal to be included in the study
